creator: willem.vanderscheun@gxs.com
text:
When I startup my apache 2.0.6 with mod_jk as root I'm getting a segmentation
fault. When I startup apache as an unprivileged user it starts up just fine.
This is the error:

[root@ams591 conf]# ../bin/apachectl start
../bin/apachectl: line 87:  8486 Segmentation fault      (core dumped) $HTTPD -k
$ARGV

When I leave out the following lines from httpd.conf I can start apache both as
root and as an unpvileged user

<IfModule !mod_jk.c>
  LoadModule jk_module modules/mod_jk.so
</IfModule>

creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
In general this works.

Are you sure, that you are using Apache httpd 2.0.6? This is *very* old and you
should update first to a more recent version, e.g. 2.0.58.

If the problem still happens, try to get a core dump and to do a backtrace (bt)
via gdb or a similar tool.

Together with the backtrace the Jk directives of your httpd configuration and
your worker properties file would be helpful.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
This was true in very old versions of mod_jk.  Current is 1.2.15 with a new
mod_jk to be released very soon.

Apache 2.0.44 and later should work, I don't know which planet you obtained
an apache 2.0.6 from but it certainly wouldn't work.

Why not recheck your apache and mod_jk versions and then check back in with us.

creator: willem.vanderscheun@gxs.com
text: Sorry, the apache versuion I'm running is 2.0.46, not 2.0.6

creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text: OK, so please respond to comment #1.
Any new information on this subject?
creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de

text:
Re-opening and resetting properties as this was closed without comment by
someone who appears to have no previous input to this bug.
creator: markt@apache.org

text: Could you please check with more recent versions, if the problem is fixed?
creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de

text: Closing since no feedback for almost 4 years.
creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de
